Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000260
Special Investigation Intake Date: January 6, 2025
License #: CI820272493
Licensee Group Organization: Sisters of Good Shepherd
Licensee Designee: Megan Zambiasi
Chief Administrator: Yulonda Shell
Agency Name: VISTA MARIA - MENTAL HEALTH
Agency Address: 20651 W WARREN ST
DEARBORN HEIGHTS, MI 48127-2622
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 02/10/2026
Capacity: 16
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
1/30/2025 Video Conference DHHS Pre-Disposition Meeting
1/29/2025 Phone Other
1/28/2025 Video Conference Interview
1/08/2025 Face to Face Interview
1/08/2025 Onsite Inspection Special Investigation Initiation
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of youth
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is being sexually assaulted at the facility. Someone is
coming into the youth's room when it's dark and smells of strong
cologne. Youth reports experiencing pain and discomfort “down
there”. This has occurred more than once with the last time being
12/2/24. Youth reports being scared because her stomach is
moving and her period has been different. There is a concern
youth is pregnant and a staff member who youth has befriended is
bringing in a pregnancy test.
Investigation Interviews
The following interviews were completed on 01/08/2025 at
Visita Maria along with DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise
noted.
A meeting was held with Compliance. He was advised of the
allegations and reported that he has reviewed some video footage
between 11/29 -12/02 and did not note any concerns. He further
advised that no male staff were seen going into the room of Youth
A. He confirmed that agency policy prohibits staff from providing
any youth with any items without permission. Lastly, he advised
that Youth A was seen at the clinic and provided a pregnancy test
on 01/06/2025. The results of the pregnancy test were negative.
Youth B was interviewed. She confirmed that she is currently
placed at Rose Hall. She denied knowledge of a male staff that
smelled of strong cologne being on the unit at night. She denied
hearing any youth at the facility indicate that she was pregnant.
Youth B reported feeling safe at the agency and denied that any
male staff has entered her room at night or made her feel
uncomfortable. She further denied that staff provides food,
clothing or any type of item to youth without supervisor approval.
She specifically denied knowing or hearing any staff reported to
bring in a pregnancy test for a youth.
Youth C was interviewed. She confirmed that she is currently
placed at Rose Hall. She reported that she has been residing at
Vista Maria for 6 to 7 months. Youth C denied that she knows of a
male staff member who wears a lot of cologne. She denied that
there have been any staff members that have been sexually
inappropriate with her. Youth C reported that male staff do not
come into their rooms at night, and they will wait by the door
during security checks. She denied knowledge of a youth on the
2

unit being pregnant or of a staff that reported they would bring in a
pregnancy test.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. He reported that he is a
youth coach/counselor and will soon be transitioning into the role
of activities director. He confirmed that he has worked various
shifts on Rose Hall and is often asked to stay over from his
second shift. He denied knowledge of any youth discussing any
staff members being sexually inappropriate with them. He denied
ever being made aware that a male staff member had entered a
resident's room and reported male staff do not enter the bedroom
of youth unless it is an emergency. He reported that the female
staff make the rounds and do room checks at night. Staff 1
denied that he overheard or knows about any staff member
offering or bringing Youth A a pregnancy test. Staff 1 denied
hearing Youth A express that she wants to be pregnant or be a
mom. He lastly reported that he cannot recall any particular staff
member who wears a lot of cologne.
On 01/08/2025 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call with any additional information.
On 01/08/2025 a voicemail message was left for FCW requesting
a return call with any additional information.
On 01/28/2025 an interview of Youth A was completed at the Kids
Talk Office. DHHS specialist, Detective and Kids Talk Staff were
also present. Youth A confirmed she was placed at Rose Hall.
She stated that she thought she was at the facility to talk about
something that she told her worker. Youth A indicated that her
worker told her she would not tell anyone, but she did and she
lied. She reported she told her worker a lot of things, one that
included that her nose began burning and it was burning from
something really strong like the smell of cologne. She confirmed
she was still sleep when she smelled this cologne and also heard
talking. She reported that she doesn't know who it was because
she was half asleep. She reported that she couldn't tell if it was
male voices or female voices. She reported that she felt her
upper body rise up and then she was laid back down. Youth A
reported that she didn't say anything or report it because she
wanted to leave and didn't want an investigation to stop her from
leaving the agency. Youth A reported she remembers smelling the
really strong smell of cologne on December 2nd. She reported
that one night while she was sleeping, she was dreaming about a
bookshelf and then she felt something on the side of her neck, but
she didn't open up her eyes. She recalled that it was a rubbing
3

feeling that felt very soft and gentle. Youth A reported that there
were not any times where there was anyone who touched her
inappropriately. She reported that if this happened, she would tell
someone she trusts. Youth A also reported that a few weeks ago
she and her friends diagnosed her with a tapeworm. She reported
that they came to this conclusion because her stomach moves in
weird ways. At the conclusion of the interview, Detective advised
the case would be closed as youth did not make any disclosures.
On 01/29/2025 a telephone conversation was held with DHHS
Specialist. She advised that she spoke with Complainant who
indicated that Youth A told her there were a couple times between
November and December that she believes someone came into
her room at night, but specifically the last time was on 12/02/2024.
Youth A believed that someone came into her room because her
nostrils were filled with and burning from the smell of cologne.
The complainant also stated that Youth A told her that she felt it
hurt "down there" but was not specific about what down there
meant. Complainant further reported Youth A told her that she did
not open her eyes therefore she did not know who it was that was
in the room. Youth A reported her stomach was moving and she
thought she was pregnant.
DHHS Specialist also spoke with the therapist for Youth A who
theorized that Youth A displays indicators of psychosis due to past
sexual encounters. She confirmed that Youth A has a diagnosis
of PTSD, Conduct Disorder, and they are evaluating her for a
cognitive delay/learning disability. She denied that Youth A has
ever disclosed being sexually assaulted/abused by any staff at
Vista Maria to her.
On 01/30/2025 a DHHS Pre Disposition exit interview was held.
DHHS Specialist, FCW, Area Manager and DHHS Specialist
Supervisor were present. No findings of abuse or neglect were
made by DHHS Staff.
On 02/03/2025 a video interview was completed with Staff 2. The
DHHS specialist was also present. He reported he has been
employed at Vista Maria for 94 days and he has been on
midnights in Rose Hall the entire time. The allegations were
discussed with Staff 2. He reported that he does not recall any
specific incidents where he entered a youths room on 12/02/2024.
He reported that typically if a room needs to be entered, he will
stay in the hallway and does not cross the doorway threshold. He
reported that he will wait for a female staff or supervisor to be the
one to enter a room. He reported that he stays in the common
4

areas of the ward for the most part when he is working. Staff 2
denied that he is aware of any of the youth being worried about
being pregnant, and he did not ever hear anything of that nature.
He reported that he has not witnessed or observed any staff giving
any youth food items or bringing in anything from outside for
youth. He reported that he is not aware of any staff member
providing a pregnancy test for a youth in Rose Hall and denied
knowledge of any staff that wears a heavy amount of cologne.
Staff 2 denied that any youth have expressed concerns to him or
reported that they do not feel safe at Vista Maria or around any of
the staff members.
Documents Reviewed
Medical of Youth A - The medical record for Youth A indicates
that the visit was on 01/06/2025 at 2:05PM. A pregnancy test was
completed and results were negative.
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy - In order to promote
acceptable behavior at Vista Maria, employees are expected to
conduct themselves in a positive, professional and respectful
manner at all times in order to promote the therapeutic alliance
between the employee and the clients who are assigned into the
care of Vista Maria". The document indicates that Vista Maria
employee prohibited behaviors includes: "Engaging in any form of
sexual or other forms of harassing or bullying behavior", "abuse,
neglect or mismanagement of clients, co worker or visitor",
"immoral, violent or indecent conduct on Vista Maria property",
"giving or receiving gifts/items of value to or from clients without
immediate supervisor approval".
Review of Video Footage - The camera footage from Vista Maria
was reviewed. Footage was of Rose Hall from 8:45 pm on 12/2/24
to 7:25 am on 12/3/24. There were a total of 17 clips of footage
provided. The camera footage showed multiple different staff
enter onto and stationed on the unit. On 12/03/2024 there was
one male, and three female staff observed in the footage. One of
the female staff did not stay for the entire night shift but the other
two and the male staff member did. The staff were observed to be
cleaning around the ward, talking to and interacting with the youth
occasionally. There was a total of 2 times where one of the female
staff entered Youth A’s room. The female staff were only in the
room for a few seconds. The male staff member was not observed
to enter Youth A’s bedroom.
Tour
5

On 01/08/2025 a visit was made to the section of the unit where
Youth A is assigned. Her pod was observed to have an adequate
sleeping arrangement, and no concerns were noted. There was a
window observed on the door of the room.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation the agency was found to be
in compliance with licensing rule 4126. Agency staff provided
appropriate supervision and there was no evidence to support that
the staff had been inappropriate with the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required.
Description (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency staff failed to report suspected abuse and/or neglect of
youth.
Investigation Interviews
On 01/08/2025 an interview was completed with Staff 1 at Vista
Maria. DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
told him she was “sick” of hearing Youth A say she was pregnant,
her stomach is moving, and someone is coming into her room
because she knows it is not true. Staff 1 denied asking Staff 2 if
she made a report based on what Youth A had been saying. He
also denied that he reported the statements as suspected abuse
or neglect and reported he was unaware if Staff 2 made a report
to centralized intake.
On 01/08/2025 an interview was completed with Compliance. He
denied any knowledge of a report of suspected abuse or neglect
being made involving Youth A and allegations of sexual assault.
Documents Reviewed
Vista Maria CPL Policy: Child Protection Law Compliance
Policy: Vista Maria has a zero tolerance for child abuse, neglect,
sexual abuse and harassment of clients and staff. All Vista Maria
staff are required to immediately report to Child Protective Service
any incident where they have reasonable cause to suspect that
6

sexual abuse and harassment, child abuse or neglect (see
definitions below) has occurred as follows:
1. both verbally and in writing to their immediate supervisor,
2. by phone call immediately to Child Protective Services and
3. followed by a written report (DHS 3200) within 24 hours.
DHHS MiSACWIS Intake information was reviewed. There was
no documentation of a report of suspected abuse or neglect
regarding these issues made by Vista Maria staff.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4131-1. Agency staff failed
to report suspected abuse and/or neglect of facility youth.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was initiated at Vista Maria mental health facility following a specific allegation of sexual assault, made by Youth A, involving a male staff member entering her room at night and causing physical pain and pregnancy concerns. The investigation found no evidence to substantiate the specific assault allegation; Youth A recanted details in a forensic interview and video footage showed no male staff entering her room, leading to a finding of no violation for insufficient staff/supervision. However, the investigation did substantiate a separate violation: facility staff failed to report Youth A's concerning statements as suspected abuse or neglect as required by the Child Protection Law and internal policy, shifting the primary culpability from an individual assault to a systemic failure in mandatory reporting protocol.
